p: Twenty-one species were selected after the ethnobotanical study in Mayotte (France) and their crude extracts obtained with methanol and dichloromethane were used for biological in vitro testing (data not shown). Among the 21 species tested, Litchi chinensis was the most promising, exhibiting high anti-tyrosinase and antioxidant activities (95.1 ± 0.06%, 84.8 ± 1.87%, respectively).
